item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Sometimes at night I would sleep open-eyed underneath a sky dripping with stars. I was alive then." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "The only serious question in life is whether to kill yourself or not." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask whatâ€™s for lunch." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "There is no love sincerer than the love of food." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food." -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Part of the secret of success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Charles de Gaulle
item.description: "How can you govern a country which has 246 varieties of cheese?" -- Charles de Gaulle

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "There is one thing more exasperating than a wife who can cook and won't, and that's a wife who can't cook and will." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Ice-cream is exquisite. What a pity it isn't illegal." -- Voltaire

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "You can't just eat good food. You've got to talk about it too. And you've got to talk about it to somebody who understands that kind of food." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "As I ate the oysters with their strong taste of the sea and their faint metallic taste that the cold white wine washed away, leaving only the sea taste and the succulent texture, and as I drank their cold liquid from each shell and washed it down with the crisp taste of the wine, I lost the empty feeling and began to be happy and to make plans." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Training is everything. The peach was once a bitter almond; cauliflower is nothing but cabbage with a college education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Tis an ill cook that cannot lick his own fingers." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "All sorrows are less with bread. " -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I don't want to go to heaven. None of my friends are there." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Women are meant to be loved, not to be understood." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A good friend will always stab you in the front." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sunshine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde
